text: sorry hello my needle drops Anthony
Fantana here the Internet's busy use
music nerd and it's time for an album
review zombie escape velocity zombie is
a duo one of my favorite duo's which is
why it makes absolutely no sense
whatsoever that it's taking me until now
to talk about their new album but now
that I'm feeling this record
up and down in a very sexy way if you
can imagine it I'm liking what I'm
hearing because the music on this thing
moves in a very interesting direction
for these guys
zombie plays a very sound track ready
style of synthesizer rock that has been
changing a little bit over the course of
the duo's past two LPs slowly these guys
have been drifting away from their
dependence on the synthesizer drifting
away from their tangerine dream roots
and now they're incorporating more bass
guitar more electric guitar and even
more acoustic guitar all of it reached a
peak on the album's spirit animal which
might had been too much of a change for
some fans it was a thicker sound a
heavier sound a more rock-oriented sound
but I liked it it was a lot less Spacey
but to me still very thought-provoking
with zombie dishing out one long-winded
and femme ik epic after another escape
velocity basically throws all of the
instruments Sambi has been furnishing
their music with out the window and they
basically get back to the basics of
drums and synthesizers of course that
doesn't mean this zombie LP feels empty
less lush less sound heavy because Steve
more just fills in all of these newly
formed gaps with more synthesizers just
bubbling arpeggios that are
sequenced and carry out through an
entire tract just wailing synth leads
some synth sounds that even sound like
horns at some points nearly all of the
five songs here really function on an
ark really slow quiet introduction to
begin things and slowly the sounds get
louder more instruments sort of
introduced themselves more melodies
phrases just repeat into this
never-ending groove the grooves get
harder tension builds and I like that I
like that kind of stuff my issue is that
some of the arcs on this album are more
tense more thrilling more climactic than
others like the title track for instance
I wish it were a little bit more subtle
and also it kind of exposes the issue
that some people may have about zombie
it's that you know the drums are really
great
AEE Patera is a fantastic drummer and he
just puts so much intricacy into his
fills his changes all of that
but sometimes hearing him laid against
these repeating synthesizer phrases that
are just kind of punched into this one
tempo can't expose how flat zombie can
feel sometimes maybe you know just
needing a little bit more of a human
touch my favorite song on the album that
was d-iii which is a great combination
of this new stripped-down version of
zombie where they're getting back to
their roots
and also the more ambitious directions
they were pursuing on spirit animal
because that song doesn't really
function on one single arc there are
many climaxes throughout the track it's
really a rollercoaster ride that not
only goes up and down but twists
sideways it's it's the most
multi-dimensional song on the album the
last track cuts out a little early for
me with a fade-out and the thing is my
only real issue with this LP is that the
entire album itself cuts out a little
early I know we've had some solo stuff
coming out building up until this point
but still considering this band's last
album was three years ago and it was
almost an hour long to hear these guys
only make music for
34 minutes is a little hmm
still this is another solid zombie album
for me that comes on slow reveals more
detail with each listen and sounds like
something that would be best fit for the
soundtrack of a 70s or 80s b-movie that
has some kind of storyline that that
takes place in space where this space
pirate has become a stowaway on this
military ship and he's climbing through
the air ducts and shooting people with
lasers who are wearing uniforms and and
basically taking over the ship he's kind
of like a space pirate ninja of course
this movie is loaded with with terrible
effects and dialogue and acting but hey
the soundtrack is good basically feeling
a strong seven to eight on this album
but let me know what you think of it do
you love it do you hate it why and what
do you think I should review next
anthony Fantana zombie escape velocity
